docs.snippet: The wild-eyed Pence, who had a home run and a double in Game 1 of the World Series, has been integral to the Giants’ success since he arrived in 2012....
docs.lead_paragraph: The wild-eyed Pence, who had a home run and a double in Game 1 of the World Series, has been integral to the Giants’ success since he arrived in 2012.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that right fielder Hunter Pence, who had a home run and a double in Game 1 of the World Series, has been integral to the Giants’ success since he arrived in 2012.

headline.main: Hunter Pence, With Quirks in Personality and Play, Spurs the Giants
headline.print_headline: Pence, With Quirks in Personality and Play, Spurs the Giants

docs.snippet: Pitcher Luther Taylor starred at a school for the deaf in the Kansas City metropolitan area before helping the Giants reach the 1905 World Series....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pitcher Luther Taylor starred at a school for the deaf in the Kansas City metropolitan area before helping the Giants reach the 1905 World Series.
docs.abstract: Luther Taylor, a pioneering pitcher at Kansas School for the Deaf from 1884-1895, could neither hear nor speak but helped New York Giants win their first World Series in 1905; colorful and charismatic character remains a unique link between Kansas City and the Giants.

headline.main: From Kansas to Giants, a Pioneer’s Trail of Wins and Wit
headline.print_headline: A Pioneer Pitcher’s Trail of Wins and Wit

docs.snippet: The Royals rebounded from their loss in Game 1 of the World Series by powering past the Giants in a game that included a tense exchange in the sixth inning....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Royals rebounded from their loss in Game 1 of the World Series by powering past the Giants in a game that included a tense exchange in the sixth inning.
docs.abstract: Kansas City Royals defeat San Francisco Giants, 7-2, in Game 2 of the World Series; Royals explode for five runs in the sixth inning, capped by Omar Infante’s two-run homer off Hunter Strickland, Giants’ beleaguered reliever.

headline.seo: World Series 2014: Royals Beat Giants in Game 2
headline.main: Tempers Heat Up; So Do Kansas City’s Bats
headline.print_headline: Tempers Heat Up; So Do Royals’ Bats

docs.snippet: Jim Thorpe's remains will stay in the Pennsylvania hamlet named for the legendary Native American athlete and Olympics champion, after a federal appeals court on Thursday rejected an effort by two sons to move them to tribal lands in his native Ok...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jim Thorpe's remains will stay in the Pennsylvania hamlet named for the legendary Native American athlete and Olympics champion, after a federal appeals court on Thursday rejected an effort by two sons to move them to tribal lands in his native Oklahoma.
